SEARCH
Package org.example.ticketingapp.controller

Class VendorEventConfigController

java.lang.Object
org.example.ticketingapp.controller.VendorEventConfigController
@CrossOrigin @RestController @RequestMapping("/api/config") public class VendorEventConfigController extends Object
Controller class for handling vendor event configuration-related requests. This class provides endpoints for managing vendor event configurations. The class is annotated with RestController to indicate that it is a REST ful web service controller. It is also annotated with CrossOrigin to allow cross-origin requests. The base URL for all endpoints in this class is "/api/config".

  • Method Details

    • getConfigsByEmail

      @GetMapping("/event") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<VendorEventConfigDTO>> getConfigsByEmail(@RequestHeader("Authorization") String token)
      Returns all the VendorEventConfigs created by the vendor email.
      Parameters:
      token - the JWT token included in the request header
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the list of vendor event configurations

    • createConfig

      @PostMapping("/event") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<VendorEventConfigDTO> createConfig(@RequestHeader("Authorization") String token, @Validated @RequestBody VendorEventConfigDTOIn vendorEventConfigDTOIn)
      Create a new VendorEventConfig, only if logged in as a vendor.
      Parameters:
      token - the JWT token included in the request header
      vendorEventConfigDTOIn - the data of the vendor event configuration to create
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the created vendor event configuration

    • updateVendorEventConfig

      @PutMapping("/event/{eventName}/{totalTickets}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<VendorEventConfigDTO> updateVendorEventConfig(@RequestHeader("Authorization") String token, @PathVariable String eventName, @PathVariable int totalTickets)
      Updates the VendorEventConfig totalTicket parameter, only if logged in as a vendor and it already exists.
      Parameters:
      token - the JWT token included in the request header
      eventName - the name of the event for which the configuration is being updated
      totalTickets - the new number of tickets to be added for the event total ticket number
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the updated vendor event configuration

    • deleteVendorEventConfig

      @DeleteMapping("/event/{eventName}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Object> deleteVendorEventConfig(@RequestHeader("Authorization") String token, @PathVariable String eventName)
      Deletes a VendorEventConfig by event name, only if logged in as a vendor.
      Parameters:
      token - the JWT token included in the request header
      eventName - the name of the event for which the configuration is being deleted
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity indicating the result of the operation

    • getAllVendorEventConfigs

      @GetMapping("/all") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<VendorEventConfigDTO>> getAllVendorEventConfigs(@RequestHeader("Authorization") String token)
      Get all VendorEventConfigs if logged in as a customer/admin.
      Parameters:
      token - the JWT token included in the request header
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the list of all vendor event configurations
